Pan-India SIR announced: No need for documents at enumeration stage; to begin on Nov 4
description: The Election Commission has altered norms for the pan-India Special Summary Revision (SIR), eliminating document submission at the enumeration stage. Electors not linked to previous SIR will receive notices to prove citizenship, with Aadhaar accepted solely as identity proof. The process, spanning 103 days, will see concurrent notice, enumeration form decision, and claims/objections handling.

Despite the smog, stubble burning contributed minimally. Authorities are now planning cloud seeding to induce artificial rain amid forecasts of light showers, hoping to improve the air.

title: Why QTCinderella faces backlash over Twitch stream racism and homophobia

While some defended her, others accused her of enabling harmful behavior, leading to a fellow streamer distancing herself.

description: Popular American YouTuber and motivational creator Ben Bader has died in a sudden accident, reportedly a freak sauna incident. His stepsister confirmed his passing, remembering him as a kind soul who inspired thousands with his messages of hope and purpose. Bader's digital legacy, known as "The Ben Effect," continues to impact fans worldwide.

title: GM layoffs: Engineers fired on Microsoft Teams; Says it's business, not you
description: General Motors has let go of over 200 salaried employees, mainly CAD engineers, at its Michigan tech campus. This move, part of a restructuring to boost profits, follows strong third-quarter earnings and a raised financial outlook. GM stated the layoffs target execution roles to enhance core design capabilities. This comes as the automotive sector sees broader workforce reductions.

title: Sugar, honey, or monk fruit: Which is healthier, according to a nutritionist
description: Sweeteners spark debate: nutritionist Suman Agarwal clarifies options beyond sugar. While jaggery and honey offer some benefits, they aren't calorie-free. Dates are a good choice in moderation. Zero-calorie stevia and monk fruit are safer alternatives to artificial sweeteners. Ultimately, limiting all added sugars, even healthier ones, is key for long-term health, according to WHO guidelines and studies.
